column4: Hello, does anyone have an idea where I could get warty-4.10.iso ?
why isn't it?
can't I run iso files from it?
it's more than 18 months old
Ubuntu releases are supported for 18 months (except LTS ones)
you want to install over a network?
so, you want to do a netinstall then, right?
that's what this page is suggesting
You don't need warty, you can install with any version, here's a good url of various install methods
that'll cover all your bases, you should be able to get something to work.  And, you don't need warty, Dapper should work just as well (get the alternate ISO)
dapper is the newest version, released last june.  Warty was released in October of 04 (4.10)
read that page, you'll find something.
no, there are some that don't.  Although, to be honest, if you have no CDrom, and no internet connection, how are you planning on getting the ISO on the computer to begin with?
what do you have on the computer currently?
No current OS?
did you see this page from that page? https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Installation/FromWindows
also, this page: https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Installation/FromHardDriveWithFloppies
no, that floppy thing is just to get a basic linux system running, once you do that, you can mount your ISO as a CDrom, and work from there.  read the pages, not just the headings
and, that first page (the windows one) shows you how to set up that basic linux system, which you can then use in conjunction with the second page
I just found a Celeron 1GHz 256MB RAM with a CD drive there. Think the CD installation would work if I put my HD there?
uh, sure.
